Don't feed the trolls. 
@Boide: you don't understand tr99tr's comment; his comment says  nothing bad about the French. He might be suggesting that the uploader is kissing ass, but that's it.

@ nutella59: Your arguments lack perspective, depth, and intelligence. So Islam should be "fought"? I assume you mean the Muslims should be fought, since you can't literally fight a concept or an idea. What about the ones living here in Europe, maybe they should be put in concentration camps? Wouldn't that make a great "Endlösung" for you? Your claim that most Muslim countries were allied with the Nazi's are not true. Most were neutral, some were still beholden to their colonial slave-masters, and only independent Muslim forces allied with the Germans. Haj Mohammed Effendi Amin el-Husseini were the Grandmufti of Jerusalem, and was trying to stop a Zionist takeover of his country, you can debate if his decisions were wise, but they are understandable. So what if a few Muslims allied with the Nazis? What kind argument is that, when the Nazis themselves were all white Christian Europeans? You might not be mad, but "Islam must be fought before it's going to cost too many lives" was pretty much the exact reasoning behind the Norwegian mass-murderer Anders Behring Breivik's killing of 77 people.

@nutella59: Your facts about Sufism are incorrect as well. While the Sufi historically have been persecuted, there's religious freedom in Turkey today, and the Whirling Dervishes of the Mawlaw'īyya Sufi are a popular tourist attraction, and an iconic image used in tourism advertising for Turkey.
